content.webTitle: Trump's 'witch hunt' radar pointing to DoJ | The minute

fields.headline: Trump's 'witch hunt' radar pointing to DoJ
fields.bodyText: After reports that the special counsel is investigating Donald Trump for obstruction of justice, Trump appeared to accuse deputy attorney general Rod Rosenstein, whom he had praised for recommending the firing of James Comey, of conducting a “witch hunt”. Trump confirms inquiry Rosenstein appointed the special counsel, Robert Mueller. The boulder set loose by Trump’s latest tweet could lead to Rosenstein’s recusal from the case and strengthen any obstruction of justice case against Trump, legal experts say. Meet Mueller’s team Speaking to a favorable crowd in Miami, Trump reversed Barack Obama’s policy of opening the way for trade and travel between the US and Cuba. In his speech, Trump decried the Cuban missile crisis, which occurred in 1962. Reversal on Cuba Now that I am your president, America will expose the crimes of the Castro regime. Effective immediately, I am canceling the last administration’s completely one-sided deal with Cuba. – Donald Trump As the Russia investigation grows, Mike Pence hired a personal lawyer this week. And now NBC News has reported that Trump’s longtime lawyer, Michael Cohen, has hired a lawyer of his own. Better safe than sorry? Sessions hosted Russia lobbyist It might take just a minute to catch up on the latest politics news. But good journalism takes time and costs money. Doctors expect Scalise, whose condition has stabilized, to remain hospitalized for weeks.
